text:
When Tomcat tries to display a directory or a directory listing on a Japanese 
W2K, Adv. Server, it cannot do it.
Install Apache,
Install Tomcat,
When Tomcat and Apache are running, open browser, enter localhost or 
127.0.0.1/examples

the directory listings for Tomcat should come up. Instead, at the Tomcat command 
window there is an IOException. Stating the character is not an 
ISO 8859_1 character.  (No directories or filenames are being passed which 
contain double-byte characters, all files and dirs are in English at this point, 
it may be passed by OS).

Here is what appears on the Tomcat console:

Directory Listing for:/examples 
Up to:/ 
Subdirectories:  
      images/           Error: 500
Location: /examples
Internal Servlet Error:

java.io.IOException: Not an ISO 8859_1 character:?
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.core.BufferedServletOutputStream.print(BufferedServletOutputSt
ream.java:221)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.request.DirHandler.doService(StaticInterceptor.java:642)
	at org.apache.tomcat.core.Handler.service(Handler.java:286)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.core.ServletWrapper.service(ServletWrapper.java:372)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.internalService(ContextManager.java:797)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.service(ContextManager.java:743)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.service.connector.Ajp12ConnectionHandler.processConnection(Ajp
12ConnectionHandler.java:166)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.service.TcpWorkerThread.runIt(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:416)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.util.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:498)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)
creator: pgiforos@novell.com

text:
I don't have the resources to duplicate this.  There have been some changes in 
this area so it may be fixed in 3.2.2b2.  If not it will be evaluated for a 
later release.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: *** Bug 1282 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
